entries.meaning: An extravagant indulgence; a spending spree. [from 1928]

verbs.description: splurge (third-person singular simple present splurges, present participle splurging, simple past and past participle splurged)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, informal) To (cause to) gush; to flow or move in a rush.
examples: The tomato sauce was splurged all over the chips.

entries.meaning: (colloquial) To spend lavishly or extravagantly, especially money. [from 1911]
examples: They decided to splurge on the biggest banana split for dessert.

entries.meaning: To produce an extravagant or ostentatious display.
